commands.title: n8n CLI: Export all workflows
commands.description: Export all workflows from n8n database to a single JSON file - useful for backups (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export all workflows (backup mode)
commands.description: Export each workflow to separate JSON files in specified directory - creates individual backup files (docs.n8n.io/workflows/export-import/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export workflow by ID
commands.description: Export specific workflow by ID - use for selective backup or migration (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export workflow (pretty JSON)
commands.description: Export workflow with formatted/pretty JSON for easier readability - useful for debugging (latenode.com/blog/n8n-export-import-workflows-complete-json-guide-troubleshooting-common-failures-2025)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Import workflow from file
commands.description: Import workflow(s) from JSON file - WARNING: overwrites workflows with same IDs (docs.n8n.io/workflows/export-import/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Import multiple workflows (separate files)
commands.description: Import multiple workflow JSON files from directory - useful for batch restore (community.n8n.io/t/importing-workflows-and-credentials/45142)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export all credentials
commands.description: Export all credentials (encrypted) - requires same N8N_ENCRYPTION_KEY for import (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export credentials (backup mode)
commands.description: Export each credential to separate JSON files - creates individual backup files (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Export credentials (decrypted)
commands.description: Export credentials in decrypted format - SECURITY WARNING: contains plaintext secrets, handle with extreme care (community.n8n.io/t/how-to-export-import-all-my-workflows-using-cli-with-decrypted-flag/124578)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Import credentials from file
commands.description: Import credentials from JSON file - requires matching N8N_ENCRYPTION_KEY (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Import multiple credentials (separate files)
commands.description: Import multiple credential JSON files from directory (community.n8n.io/t/importing-workflows-and-credentials/45142)

commands.title: n8n CLI: List all workflows
commands.description: List all workflows in the database with their IDs and names - useful for finding workflow IDs (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Uninstall community node
commands.description: Remove/uninstall a community node package - useful if node causes instability or crashes (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Reset user management
commands.description: Reset user management to pre-setup state - WARNING: removes all user accounts (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Run security audit
commands.description: Run security audit on n8n instance - checks for potential security issues like exposed credentials (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Start n8n with tunnel
commands.description: Start n8n with tunnel for external webhook access - DEV/TESTING ONLY, not for production (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n Docker: Export workflows from container
commands.description: Export all workflows from n8n Docker container to file inside container - run as 'node' user to avoid permission issues (docs.n8n.io/hosting/installation/docker/)

commands.title: n8n Docker: Copy exported file from container
commands.description: Copy exported workflow file from container to host filesystem - complete the backup process (docs.n8n.io/hosting/installation/docker/)

commands.title: n8n Docker: Import workflows to container
commands.body: docker cp {{workflows.json}} {{container-name}}:/tmp/workflows.json && docker exec -u node -it {{container-name}} n8n import:workflow --input=/tmp/workflows.json
commands.description: Copy workflow file to container and import - two-step process for Docker environments (community.n8n.io/t/importing-workflows-and-credentials/45142)

commands.title: n8n Docker: Run CLI command in container
commands.description: Execute any n8n CLI command inside Docker container as 'node' user (docs.n8n.io/hosting/installation/docker/)

commands.title: n8n Docker: Check n8n version in container
commands.description: Display n8n version running in Docker container - useful for troubleshooting version-specific issues (docs.n8n.io/hosting/installation/docker/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Execute workflow from command line
commands.description: Execute a workflow directly from CLI - useful for testing and debugging (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Activate workflow
commands.description: Activate a workflow via CLI without using the UI - useful for automation (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Deactivate workflow
commands.description: Deactivate a workflow via CLI - useful for emergency stops or troubleshooting (docs.n8n.io/hosting/cli-commands/)

commands.title: n8n CLI: Complete backup script (workflows + credentials)
commands.description: Complete backup of workflows and credentials with timestamp in filename - best practice for regular backups (community.n8n.io/t/back-up-your-n8n-workflows-to-github/1534)
